name: mislearn
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to learn something in the wrong way: The speaker said there was nothing more dangerous than mislearning lessons of history. They had misunderstood or mislearned the rules for using "an" rather than "a", and thought that "an good egg" (rather than "a good egg") was correct.
More examplesFewer examplesNew generations have continued to mislearn the story.I had just learned that asparagus was related to a garden flower – although I had actually mislearned it and put it in the wrong flower family.Where consonant production has been mislearned, speech and language therapy may be required to remediate the resulting speech disorder.
